page.title: 04Flamsteed Centre
page.content: The Flamsteed Centre was built in 1952. The centre is now 33 years old. Roughly 305 people go there a week. There is a man called Mr Symes who has been working there for 7 years. The centre is open every day of the week for elderly and disabled people. On three days a week they have their dinner there - Monday, Tuesday and Thursday. Dinner is cooked in the centre's kitchen by voluntary workers. Most days it is run by volunteers. On Saturdays it is let to people for weddings, 21st birthdays and often in the evenings for discos. Monday, Thursday and Friday are the most popular days. Before today it was a civil defence unit and then was bought by the County Council for a Social Service Centre for helping those in need.
